DataElement.preferredName: Uncertain Complete Response Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma Observed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date on which all criteria for complete response uncertain for non-Hodgkin's lymphoma were first reported in a patient's medical records.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Uncertain Complete Response Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma Observed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the observed uncertain complete response of a Non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Not established beyond doubt; still undecided or unknown.:The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.  This does not always mean the cancer has been cured.  Also called a complete remission.

Concepts.definition: Not established beyond doubt; still undecided or unknown.
The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.  This does not always mean the cancer has been cured.  Also called a complete remission.

Property.preferredDefinition: Distinct from Hodgkin's lymphoma both morphologically and biologically, NHL lymphoma is characterized by the absence of Reed-Sternberg cells, can occur at any age, and usually presents as a localized or generalized lymphadenopathy associated with fever and weight loss.  The clinical course varies according to the morphologic type.  NHL is clinically classified as indolent, aggressive, or having a variable clinical course.  NHL can be of B-or T-/NK-cell lineage. --2003:Observed; discovered or determined by scientific observation.

Concepts.definition: Distinct from Hodgkin lymphoma both morphologically and biologically, non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL) is characterized by the absence of Reed-Sternberg cells, can occur at any age, and usually presents as a localized or generalized lymphadenopathy associated with fever and weight loss. The clinical course varies according to the morphologic type. NHL is clinically classified as indolent, aggressive, or having a variable clinical course. NHL can be of B-or T-/NK-cell lineage.
Ascertained or determined through monitoring or observation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
